title: Project-Based Education for Practical Nonlinear System Observer Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic control theory and linear systems comprehension, differential equations fundamentals, and simple programming experience
context.additional_context: Designs practical case-focused projects implementable in smartphone-centric environments. Includes hands-on experience with observer design using neural network-based approaches.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the design principles of a KKL observer that accounts for time-delay measurement impacts.
Learners can implement a state-transition-based observer chain design process as a project.
Learners can apply neural network-based observer parameter estimation methods in experimental settings.
Learners can validate observer robustness against measurement noise and approximation errors using evaluation methodologies.

resources: Delayed measurement effect educational animation materials
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
